properties.areaDesc: Waters from Savannah GA to Altamaha Sound GA extending from 20 nm to 60 nm; Waters from Edisto Beach SC to Savannah GA extending from 20 nm to 40 nm; Coastal waters from Savannah GA to Altamaha Sound GA out 20 nm ...including Grays Reef National Marine Sanctuary
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 13 at 5:29PM EST by NWS Charleston SC
properties.description:
At 529 PM EST, thunderstorms were located along a line extending from
near Buoy L to near Altamaha Sound, moving east at 50 knots.

HAZARD...Winds up to 30 knots.

IMPACT...Expect briefly stronger winds and suddenly higher waves.
Put on a personal flotation device.

Marine locations impacted through 630 PM EST include:
Tug Rio Caroni...                 Sayler Barge...
Doboy Sound Buoy D...             Buoy J...
K T K Buoy...                     Tug Senasqua...
Latex Barge...                    Buoy L...
Buoy B H...                       Grays Reef Buoy...
Tug Rio Apon...                   C C A Buoy...
Altamaha Sound...                 John Bird...
D R H Buoy...                     R7 Tower...
Honey Barge...                    Sapelo Buoy S...
Steel Barge Modena...             Dredge Henry...
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots, locally higher
waves, lightning strikes, and poor visibility in heavy rain. Boaters
should seek safe harbor immediately until these storms pass.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS THUNDERSTORMS IMPACTING THE COASTAL WATERS
